titles.title: To provide for the extension of a hydroelectric project located in the State of West Virginia.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 104-321.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 172.

action.text: Mr. Schaefer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 236.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/28/1995--Introduced. Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon request of a certain licensee, to extend the time required to commence construction of a specified hydroelectric project located in West Virginia, so as to terminate on September 26, 1999. Instructs the Commission to reinstate any expired license for such project and to extend the time required for commencement of construction until September 26, 1999.
